intro: Tarrietia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower tarrietia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
